Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 26 of his 28 points in the first half, leading the Boston Celtics to a 123-93 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.
Hawks guard Trae Young left the game in the third quarter with a right rib strain after scoring only two points.
The Celtics went on a 19-4 run to close the second quarter, pushing a seven-point lead to 22.
The Celtics hit 18 3-pointers, including 15 in the first half, and outscored the Hawks 54-18 from behind the 3-point line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics have won 16 straight games when Jaylen Brown does not play.
At 7-1, the Celtics are off to their best start since the 2019-20 season.
